answers.answer: You cannot catch anaemia.Make an appointment to see your doctor as soon as you can.The symptoms that you describe can be due to a few different disorders and the doctor would arrange for a blood test to find out if you have them or not.The two that immediately come to mind are Diabetes and Thyroid problems.  With anaemia, although you would always feel tired, you would not have any appetite.Having parasites and especially tapeworm can also make you feel hungry all the time and not put any weight on.  A stool test should be done if the blood tests I mentioned above come back negative.Make an appointment soon and get checked out.Let me know how you get on.

I know its not contagious but isnt it hereditary?  i dont have thyroid and i dont think its Diabetes. a co worker thinks it something else is starts with Hypo (HYPER)? I now am shaking like my hands keep shaking and i eat and it stops. ?

No normal anaemia is not hereditary.The symptoms that you have just described in your last post "I now am shaking like my hands keep shaking and i eat and it stops."  This is very typical of hypoglycaemia.   Hypoglycaemia happens when the sugar levels in the blood steam drop low.It does not necessarily mean that you have diabetes.  Hence it is a good idea to see your doctor and get checked out.  The doctor arrange for you to have a glucose test, or a HBA1C blood test to check your blood sugars.Make sure that you do not go too long without having anything to eat.  Always carry some biscuits or other sugary food in the event you get an "attack".  But the best way to deal with this is to ensure that you eat small meals on a regular basis and have a healthy snack in between meals.We all have a thyroid, it is a question whether it produces too much or not enough thyroxin that can cause a thyroid problem.Make that appointment to see your doctor and get checked out - the symptoms you describe can very well be diabetes.Let me know how you get on.
